usefulItems: bowl, wooden skewer, wire rack, 12-hole muffin tray, silicone cupcake moulds, cupcake liners, oven
title: Mini French apple cakes

ingredients.content: 140 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
2 green apples, peeled, cored and cut into pieces (1 cm)
2 red apples, peeled, cored and cut into pieces (1 cm)
40 g dark rum, plus 1 extra tablespoon

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease 12 silicone cupcake moulds or paper cupcake liners with butter and place into a 12-hole muffin tray and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, without measuring cup<b>. Remove mixing bowl and swirl melted butter around base of mixing bowl (see Tips).
<b>Insert measuring cup<b>. Cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> or until butter becomes golden brown.Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool slightly (approx. 5 minutes).
Place apples, lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of the rum into mixing bowl and cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>, without measuring cup<b>. Using simmering basket, drain the liquid from apples.
Place white sugar, baking powder, salt, eggs, milk, vanilla, remaining 40 g rum and reserved browned butter into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add flour and half of the cooked apples and mix <b>15 sec//speed 2<b>. Divide mixture between silicone moulds or baking cups. Top each muffin with remaining apples, sprinkle with raw sugar, then bake for 30-35 minutes (180°C), until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the cakes comes out clean. Set aside to cool in muffin tray for 15 minutes, then transfer onto a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Swirling the melted butter prevents it from catching on the bottom of the mixing bowl.
